navItems.name: Rare Dementia
navItems.description: Alzheimer’s disease is the most common cause of dementia, but there are many other diseases and conditions that can lead to dementia. These conditions are rarer, can occur at a younger age, and can cause symptoms that are not only memory-related. These include difficulties with vision, language, movement and behavioural changes.
